gs ch 67 compliance with state rabies laws required  article supplemental to state rabies laws a it shall be unlawful for any animal owner or other person to fail to comply with the state laws relating to the control of rabies b it is the purpose of this article to supplement such state laws by providing a procedure for the enforcement of state laws relating to rabies control in addition to the criminal penalties provided by state law  vaccination of dogs and cats required  tag a it shall be unlawful for an owner or keeper of any dog or cat four months of age or older to fail to provide such animal with a current vaccination against rabies hydrophobia by a licensed veterinarian with antirabies vaccine as required by the general statutes b it shall be unlawful for any dog or cat owner or keeper to fail to provide the dog or cat with a collar or harness to which a current rabies tag issued under this section is securely attached the collar or harness with the attached tag must be worn at all times c in addition to all other penalties prescribed by law a dog or cat is subject to impoundment in accordance with the provisions of this chapter if the dog or cat is found not to be wearing a currently valid rabies tag d it shall be unlawful for any person to use a rabies vaccination tag for an animal other than the animal for which the tag was issued e all dogs and cats shipped or otherwise brought into the city except for exhibition purposes where dogs and cats are confined and not permitted to run at large shall be securely confined and vaccinated within one week after such entry and shall remain confined for two additional weeks after vaccination unless accompanied by a certificate issued by a licensed veterinarian showing that the dog or cat is apparently free from rabies and has not been exposed to rabies and that the dog or cat has received a proper dose of rabies vaccine not more than six months prior to the date of issuance of the certificate  areawide emergency quarantine when reports indicate a positive diagnosis of rabies to the extent that lives of persons are endangered the mayor shall issue a proclamation declaring an areawide quarantine for such period of time as he deems necessary upon invoking such emergency quarantine no dog or cat may be taken or shipped from the city without written permission of the animal control officer or duly authorized agent during such quarantine the animal control officer law enforcement officers or person duly authorized may seize and impound any dog or cat found running at large in the city  buildings housing standards gs 160a441 et seq findings  intent it is hereby found that the following exists within the city 1 abandoned structures which the city council finds to be hazardous to the health safety and welfare of the residents of the city due to the attraction of insects or rodents conditions creating a fire hazard dangerous conditions constituting a threat to children or frequent use by vagrants as living quarters in the absence of sanitary facilities  2 dwellings that are unfit for human habitation due to dilapidation defects increasing the hazards of fire accidents or other calamities lack of ventilation light or sanitary facilities or due to other conditions rendering the dwellings unsafe or unsanitary or dangerous or detrimental to the health safety morals or otherwise inimical to the welfare of the residents of the city therefore pursuant to the authority granted by gs 160a441 it is the intent of this article to provide for the repair closing demolition or removal of such dwellings or structures  supplemental nature nothing in this article shall be construed to abdicate or impair the powers of the courts or any department of the city to enforce any provisions of its charter ordinances or regulations nor to prevent or punish violations thereof the powers conferred by this article shall be in addition and supplemental to the powers conferred by any other law  state law reference supplemental nature of part gs 160a450 plannercode enforcer officer designated as building inspector the city plannercode enforcer officer is designated as the building inspector for the purposes of this article  duties of building inspector the building inspector is designated as the city officer who shall enforce the provisions of this article it shall be the duty of the building inspector to 1 locate abandoned structures and substandard dwellings within the city and determine which of such structures are in violation of this article  2 take such action pursuant to this article as may be necessary to provide for the repair closing or demolition of such structures  3 keep an accurate record of all enforcement proceedings begun pursuant to the provisions of this article  and 4 perform such other duties as may be prescribed in this article or assigned to the building inspector by the city council  powers of building inspector the building inspector is authorized to exercise such powers as may be necessary to carry out the intent and provisions of this article including in addition to other powers granted in this article the power to 1 investigate the dwelling conditions in the city in order to determine which dwellings are unfit for human habitation  2 investigate the conditions of buildings within the city in order to determine which structures are abandoned and in violation of this article  3 enter upon premises for the purpose of making examination in a manner that will create the least possible inconvenience for the persons in possession of such premises  4 administer oaths affirmations examine witnesses and receive evidence  5 designate such other officers agents and employees of the city as he deems necessary to carry out the provisions of this article  state law reference additional powers of public officer gs 160a448 standards for enforcement a dwellings unfit for human habitation 1 the building inspector may determine that a dwelling is unfit for human habitation if he finds that conditions exist in the dwelling that render it dangerous or injurious to the health safety or morals of the occupants of the dwelling the occupants of neighboring dwellings or other residents of the city 2 notwithstanding subsection a1 of this section defective conditions may include the following a defects increasing the hazard of fire accident or other calamities  b lack of adequate ventilation light or sanitary facilities  c dilapidation  d disrepair  e structural defects  f uncleanliness  and g violations of other city ordinances the state building code standard housing code state electrical code or fire prevention code which constitute a fire hazard in such structure or which might result in danger to the occupants b abandoned structures 1 every abandoned structure within the city shall be deemed in violation of this article whenever such structure constitutes a hazard to the health safety or welfare of the citys citizens as a result of a the attraction of insects or rodents  b conditions creating a fire hazard  c dangerous conditions constituting a threat to children  or d frequent use by vagrants as living quarters in the absence of sanitary facilities 2 in making the preliminary determination as to whether or not an abandoned structure is in violation of this article the building inspector may by way of illustration and not limitation consider the presence or absence of the following conditions a holes or cracks in the structures floors walls ceilings or roof which might attract or admit rodents and insects or become breeding places for rodents and insects  b the collection of garbage or rubbish in or near the structure which might attract rodents and insects or become breeding places for rodents and insects  c violations of the state building code standard housing code state electrical code or fire prevention code which constitute a fire hazard in such structure  d the collection of garbage rubbish or combustible material which constitutes a fire hazard in such structure  e the use of such structure or nearby grounds or facilities by children as a play area  f violation of the state building code which might result in danger to children using the structure or nearby grounds or facilities as a play area  and g repeated use of such structure by transients and vagrants in the absence of sanitary facilities for living sleeping cooking drinking or eating  state law reference exercise of police power authorized finding of health or safety hazard gs 160a441  standards gs 160a444 enforcement procedure a preliminary investigations  notices  hearings  whenever a petition is filed with the building inspector by at least five residents of the city charging that any dwelling or structure exists in violation of this article or whenever it appears to the building inspector upon inspection that any dwelling or structure exists in violation of this article the building inspector shall if his preliminary investigation discloses a basis for such charges issue and cause to be served upon the owner of and parties in interest in such dwelling or structure a complaint stating the charges in such respect and containing a notice that a hearing will be held before the building inspector at a place fixed in such complaint which shall be not less than ten days nor more than 30 days after the serving of the complaint the owner and parties in interest shall be given the right to file an answer to the complaint and to appear in person or otherwise and give testimony at the place and time fixed in the complaint notice of such hearing shall also be given to at least one of the persons signing a petition relating to such structure any person who desires may attend such hearing and give evidence relevant to the matter being heard the rules of evidence prevailing in courts of law or equity shall not be controlling in hearings before the building inspector b issuance of order to correct violations  if after notice of the hearing the building inspector determines that the dwelling or structure is in violation of this article he shall state in writing his findings of fact supporting such determination and shall issue and cause to be served upon the owner of the dwelling or structure an order to correct the violation 1 in the case of an abandoned building such order shall direct and require the owner to either repair close and secure such structure or demolish and remove the structure within a specified period of time not to exceed 90 days 2 in the case of a dwelling which is determined to be unfit for human habitation a if the repair alteration or improvement of the dwelling can be made at a reasonable cost in relation to the value of the dwelling which reasonable cost shall be less than 50 percent of the value of the building the order shall require the owner within the time specified to repair alter or improve the dwelling in order to render the dwelling fit for human habitation or to vacate and close the dwelling as a human habitation  or b if the repair alteration or improvement of the dwelling cannot be made at a reasonable cost in relation to the value of the dwelling which reasonable cost shall not to be in excess of 50 percent the order shall require the owner to remove or demolish such dwelling within the time specified in the order c failure to comply with order 1 in personam remedy if the owner of any structure shall fail to comply with the order of the building inspector within the time specified in such order the building inspector may submit a resolution to the city council at its next regular meeting directing the city attorney to petition the superior court for an order directing such owner to comply with the order of the building inspector as authorized by gs 160a446g 2 in rem remedy after failure of an owner of a structure to comply with an order of the building inspector within the time specified in such order if injunctive relief has not been sought or has not been granted as provided in subsection d of this section the building inspector may submit an ordinance to the city council ordering the building inspector to cause such structure to be repaired closed or demolished as provided in the original order of the building inspector and pending such repair closing or demolition to placard such structure as provided by gs 160a4434 d petition of superior court by owner  any person aggrieved by an order issued by the building inspector shall have the right within 30 days after issuance of such order to petition the superior court for a temporary injunction restraining the building inspector pending a final disposition of the cause as provided by gs 160a446f e notice of lis pendens upon the issuance of a complaint and notice of hearing pursuant to this section the building inspector may cause the filing of a notice of lis pendens with a copy of the complaint and notice of hearing attached thereto in the office of the clerk of superior court of scotland county to be indexed and crossindexed in accordance with the indexing procedures of the north carolina general statutes the building inspector shall cause a copy of the notice of lis pendens to be served upon the owners and parties in interest in the building or dwelling at the time of filing in accordance with gs 160a445 as applicable upon compliance with the requirements of any order issued based upon such complaint and hearing the inspector shall direct the clerk of building inspector and the board which notice shall specify the grounds upon which the appeal is based upon the filing of any notice of appeal the building inspector shall forthwith transmit to the board all of the papers constituting the record upon which the appealed decision or order was made where an appeal is made of a decision or order of the building inspector refusing to allow the person aggrieved thereby to do any act the building inspectors decision or order shall remain in force until modified or reversed when any appeal is made of the decision of the building inspector requiring the person aggrieved to do any act the appeal shall have the effect of suspending the requirement until the hearing by the board unless the building inspector certifies to the board after the notice of appeal is filed with him that because of facts stated in the certificate a copy of which shall be furnished to the appellant a suspension of the building inspectors requirement would cause imminent peril to life or property in such case the requirement shall not be suspended except by a restraining order which may be granted for due cause shown upon not less than one days written notice to the building inspector by the board or a court of record upon petition made pursuant to subsection e of this section c the appeals board shall fix a reasonable time for hearing appeals and shall give due notice to the parties and shall render its decision within a reasonable time any party may appear in person or by agent or attorney the board may reverse or affirm wholly or partly or may modify the decision or order appealed the board may make any decision or order that in its opinion should be made in the matter to such end the board shall have all the powers of the building inspector but the concurring vote of four members of the board shall be necessary to reverse or modify any decision or order of the building inspector the board shall also have power in passing appeals when practical difficulties or unnecessary hardships would result from carrying out the strict letter of this article to adapt the application of this article to the necessities of the case so that the spirit of this article shall be observed public safety and welfare secured and substantial justice done d every decision of the board shall be subject to review by proceedings in the nature of certiorari instituted within 15 days of the decision of the board the decision of the board shall not otherwise be subject to review e any person aggrieved by a decision or order issued by the building inspector or a decision rendered by the board may petition the superior court for an injunction restraining the building inspector from carrying out his decision or order or the decision of the board upon such petition the court may issue a temporary injunction restraining the building inspector pending a final disposition of the cause the petition shall be filed within 30 days after issuance of the building inspectors decision or order or rendering of the decision of the board hearings shall be held by the court on a petition within 20 days and shall be given preference over other matters on the courts calendar the court shall hear and determine the issues raised and shall enter such final order or decree as law and justice may require it shall not be necessary to file a bond in any amount specifications shall be approved by the zoning enforcement officer before any permit shall be issued b all applications for a permit shall be accompanied by a permit fee the amount of which shall be set by the city council and kept on file in the offices of the city clerk and zoning enforcement officer  general requirements a pool construction shall conform to the state building and plumbing codes which are enforced by the county inspection office in the city any accessory building which houses pumping and filtering equipment must conform to the provisions of appendix a of this swimming pools inclusive of paved decks and all accessory buildings shall be located no closer than eight feet to any property line b no swimming pool shall be located in the front yard of any residence c fiberglass and plastic pools may be permitted provided they meet accepted safety and construction standards d the water department may regulate the hours for filling pools and no pool shall be drained during periods of rainfall e owners of pools shall regulate their use in a manner so as not to create any undue noise or disturbance  construction requirements a there shall be no cross connection of the city water supply with any other source of water supply for the pool the line from the city water supply to the pool shall be protected against backflow of water by means of an air gap and shall discharge at least six inches above the maximum high water level of the makeup tank or the pool b the drain line for the pool may be connected to the city sewer system if the following revisions are complied with 1 the pool drain shall be connected to the storm sewer if available 2 where a storm sewer is not available the pool drain may be connected to a sanitary sewer or a combined sewer subject to the approval of the engineering department provided an air gap discharge connection is installed  fences all swimming pools to be constructed or which are already constructed shall be enclosed by a fence which shall be at least four feet in height and shall be of a type not readily climbed by children the gates shall be of a selfclosing and latching type with the latch on the inside of the gate and not readily available for children to open  provided however that if the entire premises of the residence is enclosed then this provision may be waived by the zoning enforcement officer upon inspection and approval of the residence enclosure  inspection the zoning enforcement officer and county building inspector shall have the right at any reasonable hour to inspect any swimming pool for a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this article shall have the meanings ascribed to them in this section except where the context clearly indicates a different meaning peddler means any person firm or corporation whether as owner agent consignee or employee whether or not a resident of the city who engages in the business of carrying any goods wares or merchandise from place to place and offering to sell or barter or actually selling or bartering such goods or merchandise transient merchant itinerant merchant and itinerant vendor all such terms referred to in this article as itinerant merchant mean any person firm or corporation whether as owner agent consignee or employee whether or not a resident of the city who engages in a temporary business of selling and delivering goods wares and merchandise within the city and who in furtherance of such purpose hires leases uses or occupies any building structure motor vehicle tent trailer railroad box car truck or boat public room in hotels motels lodginghouses apartments or shops or any street alley or other place within the city for the exhibition and sale of such goods wares and merchandise either privately or at public auction provided that such definition shall not be construed to include 1 any person selling at a flea market taxed under gs 10553d 2 any person selling at a yard sale as such term is defined in section 2831 of this 3 any person firm or corporation that otherwise meets the requirements of this definition but who is part of a group of ten or more merchants selling at a shopping area or trade show and is selling at the invitation of the shopping area or trade show and where such sales activities do not last for a period of time longer than seven days 4 a traveling salesman b relief from compliance by association for the purpose of this article a person firm or corporation engaged in a transient business shall not be relieved from complying with the provisions of this chapter merely by reason of temporarily associating with any local dealer trader merchant or auctioneer or by conducting such transient business in connection with as a part of or in the name of any local dealer trader merchant or auctioneer c applicability the provisions of this section dealing with transient merchants itinerant merchants itinerant vendors and peddlers shall not apply to any person firm or corporation who sells or offers for sale books periodicals printed music ice wood for fuel fish beef mutton pork bread cakes pies dairy products poultry eggs vegetables fruits livestock or articles produced by the individual vendor offering such articles for sale but shall apply to medicines drugs or assembled articles  cross reference definitions generally  12 license and levied in an amount equal to 15 percent of the gross receipts derived from the shortterm lease or rental of vehicles at retail to the general public the tax on gross receipts is in addition to the privilege taxes authorized by gs 160a211  collection every person engaged in the business of the shortterm lease or rental of vehicles at retail to the general public shall collect at the time of the lease or rental the tax levied in this article place the tax collected in a segregated account and thereafter remit such tax to the tax collector in accordance with the provisions of this article the taxpayer shall include a provision in each retail shortterm lease or rental agreement stating that the percentage amount enacted by this article of the total lease or rental price excluding sales tax is being charged as a tax on gross receipts the amount of the tax shall be stated separately from the lease or rental and shown separately on the taxpayers records the tax shall be paid by the customer to the taxpayer as trustee for and on account of the city the taxpayer shall be liable for the collection of the tax and for the payment thereof to the tax collector and the taxpayers failure to charge or collect such tax from the customer shall not affect such liability  report and payment taxes levied under this article are due and payable when a return is required to be filed every taxpayer shall within the time specified submit a return to the tax collector on the form prescribed by the tax collector a return must be signed by the taxpayer or the taxpayers agent returns of taxpayers are due to the tax collector each month on or before the 15th day of the month following the month in which the tax accrues as provided in gs 160a2081 a return shall not be considered a public record and information contained in a return may be disclosed only in accordance therewith  records books and accounts the taxpayer shall keep and preserve suitable records of the gross receipts received by such taxpayer in the conduct of business and such other books or accounts as may be necessary to determine the amount of the tax for which such taxpayer is liable under the provisions of this article it shall be the duty of the taxpayer to keep and preserve all such records of gross receipts and other books and accounts for a period of three years all records books and accounts described in this section shall be open for examination at all reasonable hours during the day by the tax collector or his duly authorized agent  provision of forms to ensure a full collection of and an accounting for taxes due the tax collector shall design prepare print and make available to all taxpayers operating within the municipal boundaries of the city forms and instructions for filing returns the failure of any taxpayer to obtain or receive forms shall not relieve such taxpayer from the payment of the tax at the time and in the manner provided  situs the transaction giving rise to the tax levied in this article shall be deemed to have occurred at the location of the entity from which the customer takes delivery of the vehicle  administration in responsible for opening and closing graves in compliance with the following regulations failure to comply with such regulations will result in the funeral home paying a fine before any further burials are made in any city cemetery 1 any cutting of sod shall be done in sections that are removed and placed in such a manner that they can be replaced in the same order as removed 2 any soil removed from a grave must be put into trailers that are provided by the city the cemetery department will remove the trailers from the grave during business hours 3 all existing markers in the vicinity of the grave must be covered to protect them from damage during the opening and closing of graves 4 when filling graves the soil must be packed in sixinch layers as the grave is being filled to help keep the grave from settling 5 grass must be replaced level with the surrounding turf 6 the area must be left in its original state with precautions taken to prevent damage 7 funeral homes are responsible for removing grass filling and repacking graves and replacing the grass level with surrounding turf for a period of one year from the date of the burial 8 the cemetery supervisor at his discretion will notify any funeral home in writing of work that was not performed to city standards the funeral home will have a period of five working days to correct the situation if such correction is not done then a noncompliance fine will be charged  perpetual care fund a perpetual care fee as set by the city council from time to time and on file in the city clerks office shall be charged and deposited into a perpetual care fund which shall be used for maintenance of city cemeteries the fee for noncity residents shall be twice that charged city residents  violations and noncompliance a it shall be unlawful for any person to violate or fail refuse or neglect to comply with the provisions or requirements of this chapter b failure to abide by any provision of this chapter by any funeral home or memorials in any city cemetery the city manager may permanently revoke the privilege of interment or installation of memorials for repeated failure to abide by the provisions of this chapter  secs the death of a purchaser of a cemetery lot the surviving spouse of the decedent shall be recognized as the owner of the lot and in case of the death of the surviving spouse the heirs at law of the purchaser shall be recognized as the owner of the lot  reversion of lot to city a when a lot in a cemetery shall have remained without any interment for a period of 50 years and the purchaser or his assignee has died or has been removed from the city and none of their relatives is known to the city council to reside in the city the lot shall revert to the city when the conditions set forth in subsection b of this section have been complied with b the city council intending to cause the reversion to the city of an unused lot as provided in subsection a of this section shall give notice of such proposed reversion once a week for four weeks in a newspaper published in the city if no relative of the purchaser or his assignee appears within 30 days from the last day of such publication then such plot shall revert to the city  interments for remuneration it shall be unlawful for any lot holder to allow any interment to be made in his lot for any remuneration  planting of shrubs and plants by proprietor of lot the proprietor of a lot in a cemetery may be permitted to plant and cultivate shrubs and plants on the lot under the supervision and with the consent of the cemetery supervisor  cut flower receptacles permanent receptacles for cut flowers in the cemeteries shall be of metal or stone and shall be sunk below the surface of the ground in such a manner as not to interfere with the mower receptacles placed so as to interfere with the mower shall be removed at once receptacles shall not be unsightly when not filled  keeping on walks and roadways it shall be unlawful for any person visiting any cemetery to fail neglect or refuse to keep on the walks or roadways in such cemetery  boundary markers all cemetery boundary markers set by the city shall be permanent land markers it shall be unlawful for any person to move such boundary markers without proper authority  secs 1022210240  reserved division 2  construction building and repair work by masons and stone cutters the provisions of this section shall apply to the work of masons and stone cutters in the cemeteries 1 materials shall not be brought onto the grounds in large quantities in advance of their immediate use or in an unprepared condition 2 blocks of stone or marble must be dressed to the design and dimensions ready for setting 3 lime must be slacked and mortar prepared and brought to the grounds in moderate supply  supervision of masons and stone cutters masons and stone cutters working in the cemeteries shall at all times be under the supervision of the cemetery supervisor  erection of stonework in the cemeteries the erection of stonework shall be subject to the rules and regulations covering the particular cemetery section lot holders and contractors shall be furnished full information upon request  placing of enclosures and curbing it shall be unlawful for any person to place any enclosure or curbing around any lot or part thereof in any section in the cemeteries  erection and construction of steps each step erected upon any lot in the cemeteries shall be made of a single stone and shall be constructed on a solid foundation of masonry  laying of cradle tombs and slabs it shall be unlawful for any person to lay cradle tombs or slabs in the cemeteries unless such cradle tombs or slabs are laid horizontally  bringing in stone and other material it shall be unlawful for any person to bring stone or any other material into the cemeteries when the grounds thereof are not in suitable condition  loads over eight tons it shall be unlawful for any person to bring a load of more than eight tons into the grounds of the cemeteries without having first obtained permission from the cemetery supervisor  fastening of guy ropes it shall be unlawful for any person to fasten guy ropes to any tree monument or tomb in the cemeteries  moving of material in the cemeteries all material shall be moved in the paths over planks laid for such purpose and not over the adjoining lots  dilapidated enclosures a when any enclosure in the cemeteries is found to be in a dilapidated condition either from decay or want of paint so that it becomes unsightly or a nuisance the owner of any such enclosure shall be notified by the cemetery supervisor that if the enclosure is not put in good condition within ten days after such notice it shall be removed by the cemetery supervisor such a removed enclosure shall not be replaced by any other enclosure b when the owner of the dilapidated enclosure is unknown or is not a resident of the city the city council intending to cause the removal or repair of a dilapidated enclosure as provided in subsection a of this section shall give notice of such proposed removal or repair once a week for four weeks in a newspaper published in the city if the owner does not appear within 30 days from the last day of such publication the enclosure shall be removed by the cemetery supervisor such a removed enclosure shall not be replaced by any other enclosure  vaults the city manager may allow a vault to be built by the purchaser of a lot in the cemeteries the city manager shall establish specifications which shall be observed by the owner in the construction of such vault  failure to comply with rules and regulations the cemetery supervisor may immediately suspend work whenever there is a failure to conform to the applicable rules and regulations  repair of damage  responsibility for failure to comply with rules and regulations a if any damage is done by any person working in the cemeteries such damage will be repaired under the direction of the cemetery supervisor and shall be paid for by the person responsible for such damage b any workman failing to conform to the applicable rules and regulations shall be excluded from the cemeteries and the person employing him shall be responsible for the injuries sustained workmans neglect  removal of rubbish and excavated earth persons employed by lot owners to work on lots in the cemeteries shall remove all rubbish and excavated earth produced in the course of their work to dumps designated by the cemetery supervisor  unauthorized work on sundays it shall be unlawful for any unauthorized person to work in the cemeteries on sundays  secs 1025710290  reserved article vii  hillside memorial park division 1  generally definitions the article subject to the general statutes  establishment and name that certain tract of land containing 227 acres more or less located on the east side of the 401 bypass and on the west side of the laurinburg and southern railroad which was purchased by the city from giles leach and his sister cora m leach by a deed dated  which is registered in the county registry in deed book 20  shall be used exclusively as a municipal cemetery to be operated by the city under the name of hillside memorial park  plat and record the city shall keep a plat and record of the cemetery showing sections lots and subdivisions together with the location and date of all burials and the name of each person interred therein  lot prices and other charges the prices of all lots in the cemetery and the charges for clerk a true copy of such charges shall also be maintained on file in the office of the cemetery supervisor  reservation of citys right to use property not conveyed the city reserves the right to use for cemetery purposes the cemetery property which has been plotted and recorded in the office of the register of deeds of the county not sold to individual lots owners including the interring and preparing for interment of human bodies or for anything necessary incidental or convenient thereto  composition of agreement between city and lot or plot owner the certificate of ownership declaration of reservation option agreement if any and provisions of this article and any amendment thereto constitute the entire agreement between the city and the owner of any lot or plot in the cemetery  work to be done by city in the cemetery the city shall undertake and perform the following work 1 all grading landscaping and improvements of any kind 2 all care of plots 3 all planting trimming cutting and removal of trees shrubs and herbage  authority of city manager for improvements and alterations all improvements or alterations of lots or plots in the cemetery shall be under the direction and subject to the consent satisfaction and approval of the city manager should such improvements or alterations be made without the written consent of the city manager he may remove alter or change such improvements or alterations at the expense of the plot owner or if at any time when in his judgment such improvements or alterations become unsightly  motor vehicles required to stop at entrance the city reserves the right to compel all persons driving motor vehicles into the cemetery to bring such vehicles to a full stop at the entrance to such cemetery  use of avenues walks alleys and roads  liability for injuries persons within the cemetery shall use only the avenues walks alleys and roads any person injured in the cemetery while walking on the grass or any portion of the cemetery other than the avenues walks alley or roads shall in no way hold the city liable for any injuries sustained  trespassers on plots only the plot owner and his relatives shall be permitted on any plot in the cemetery any other person on such plot shall be considered a trespasser the city shall owe no duty to any such trespasser to keep the property or memorial on such plot in a reasonably safe condition  secs 1030310320  reserved division 2  interments disinterments and removals application for interment or opening of burial space in the absence of the owners declaration of reservation the cemetery supervisor may refuse interment in any plot and refuse to allow the opening of any burial space for any purpose except upon written application by the plot owner of record made out on forms provided by the management and duly filed in the office of the management  interment of more than one body in single grave or vault not more than one body or the remains of more than one body shall be interred in a single grave or vault except in the case of a mother and her newborn baby unless such grave or vault has been purchased in the written agreement that more than one body or the remains of more than one body may be interred therein or unless the cemetery supervisor shall have given its written consent thereto interment shall not be permitted unless proper identification shall be made of such interment on one regulation memorial or marker  interment in lot owned by church lodge or other society where a lot is owned by a church lodge or other society interment shall be limited to the actual be unlawful for the heirs of the original owner of the lot or plot to remove a body from such plot or lot so that such lot or plot may be sold for profit  removal of body to different lot or plot a body or the remains thereof may be removed from the original lot or plot in which it was originally buried to a different lot or plot in the cemetery when there has been an exchange or purchase for such purpose  secs 1032610350  reserved division 3  sale of lots price of lots a all lots in hillside memorial park are to be offered for sale at prices set by the city council from time to time which fees shall be on file in the office of the city clerk b the sales price per lot in hillside memorial park to nonresidents of the city shall be twice the sales price that is in effect for the residents of the city  installment payments the purchase price of any of the lots in the cemetery may be paid in installments in such case the purchaser shall execute a signed contract in a form to be approved by the city manager which shall provide the following 1 payment shall be made in weekly semimonthly or monthly installments 2 the maximum length of the time allowed for the payment of the total purchase price shall not exceed 24 months 3 a cash payment upon each lot shall be made by the purchaser at the time of the execution of the contract the payment shall in no event be less than the minimum cash payment for a lot of that classification to be determined by the city manager 4 each installment shall be paid on or before the date provided for such payment in the written contract to purchase if any payment shall not be made on or before the date when the payment shall be due a service charge the amount of which shall be set by the city council from time to time and kept on file in the city clerks office shall be added to such payment for each and every month or fraction thereof that the payment may be delinquent if any payment shall be past due and unpaid for as long as 90 days the city manager may at his option declare the contract to have been breached by the purchaser and may apply all payments previously made as liquidated damages for the breach of such contract provided that a if the contract covered a fourgrave lot and 30 percent of the base price thereof shall have been paid a certificate of ownership shall then be issued for a onegrave lot but the location thereof may be changed to another location of the same classification in the sole discretion of the city manager  b if the contract covered a fourgrave lot and 60 percent of the base price shall have been paid a certificate of ownership shall then be issued for a twograve lot but the location thereof may be changed to another location of the same classification in the sole discretion of the city manager  and c if the contract covered a twograve lot and 60 percent of the base price shall have been paid a certificate of ownership shall then be issued for a onegrave lot but the location thereof may be changed to another location of the same classification in the sole discretion of the city manager  secs 1035310370  reserved division 4  burial rights of lot and plot owners certificate of ownership upon receipt of payment in full for any lot the city clerk shall execute and deliver a certificate of ownership to the purchaser granting to such purchaser and his heirs and assigns the exclusive right of interment in such lot subject to the rules and regulations contained in this article and any amendments thereto which may be made by the city council  right of interment when owner files declaration of reservation at the time of the purchase of a lot or plot or at any time after such purchase during the lifetime of the purchaser or transferee and in accordance with the provisions of this article the owner of any such lot or plot may present his certificate of ownership and may file with city offices a declaration of reservation specifically designating the persons entitled to be buried in any or all of the plots in the lot or vesting the right of designation for unreserved plots in a named person no other person may be buried in any plot designated by the owner in the declaration of reservation except by an amended declaration of reservation executed by the owner and filed with city offices the owner of any lot may in the declaration of reservation limit the persons entitled to be buried in such lot to the persons designated in the declaration of reservation if the owner fails to designate burial rights for each plot in such lot or shall fail to limit burials in such plot to the persons designated in the declaration of reservation then as to the plots not designated the right of burial shall be as provided in section 10373 upon application by any person for interment of a body in a given plot the burden of proof as to the identity of the person to be interred rests upon the applicant and no liability shall be incurred by the city as the result of a false statement in the application but the cemetery supervisor will make reasonable effort to see that only persons entitled to be buried in a given plot are so interred  rights of interment in absence of declaration of reservation in the absence of a declaration of reservation by the registered owner of a lot the right of interment shall be in the following order 1 one plot shall be reserved for the owner and one for the owners surviving spouse if any 2 the remaining plots in such lot shall be held in trust by the city for burial of the following persons in the order of their death and if a request is made for burial a the children of the owner and their respective spouses  b lineal descendants of the owner and their respective spouses  c parents of the owner  vested rights of lot owners and their spouses the burial rights in all lots and plots conveyed shall be presumed to be the sole and separate property of the person named as grantee in the certificate of ownership in accordance with the provisions of this division provided that the spouse shall have a vested right of interment of his body in any burial plot conveyed to the plot owner which shall continue as long as he shall remain the spouse of the plot owner or shall be his spouse at the time of such plot owners demise no conveyance or transfer shall divest the spouse of an owner of his vested right of interment with the joinder in such conveyance or transfers executed by the spouse and filed with city offices  indivisibility of lots  alienation of lot in which certain interments have been made all lots the use of which has been conveyed in a certificate of ownership are indivisible whenever an interment of the remains of a member a relative of a member of the family of the record owner or the record owner is made in a lot the lot thereby becomes inalienable and shall be held as the family plot of the owner except as otherwise provided by the owners declaration of reservation  secs 1037610400  reserved division 5  transfers or assignments restricted a the ownership of any lot plot section or burial space in hillside memorial park shall neither be assigned nor transferred to any person except the city upon such transfer the city shall refund to the owner of the certificate of ownership the amount of the purchase price originally paid for the property less the sum paid for any burial space which has already been used for the burial of the dead b the substance of this section shall be placed in every certificate of ownership issued by the city  options to purchase the city will refuse to consent to a transfer of any option to purchase a lot or plot when a balance of the purchase price is still owed to the city  transfer charge all transfers of ownership in lots or plots in the cemetery shall be subject to a charge which shall be set from time to time and a schedule of such charges is on file and available in the city clerks office the charge shall be paid to the city when the transfer is recorded  passage of lot or plot by will or laws of descent no lot or plot in the cemetery may be bequeathed or devised by will like other property or real estate nor shall any such lot or plot descend according to the laws of descent and distribution  secs 1040510420  reserved division 6  decoration of plots right to regulate the city markers a fountain myrtle and rose sections only firstclass bronze granite or marble markers shall be allowed such markers shall be set level with the ground at the head of each plot except in the case of a family marker which shall be set at the head and center of the plot b estate section 1 only first quality granite or natural cut stone monuments will be permitted in the estate section 2 all monuments shall be set on uniform lines as prescribed by the cemetery supervisor to conform to the general plan of the estate section    412008 monument specifications a the length of a monument base shall not exceed 60 percent of the width of the lot b foundation requirements are as follows 1 all foundations shall extend five inches from the monument base and shall be dug to the proper depth 2 after the foundation is dug the soil must be thoroughly compacted 3 concrete mixture for the foundation shall be one part cement two parts sand and two parts stone 4 monuments weighing 3003500 pounds shall have a minimum foundation depth of six inches or manufacturers specifications whichever is greater wet concrete must cure for a period of three days prior to installation of the monument 5 monuments weighing less than 300 pounds and footstones shall have a minimum foundation depth of four inches of wet concrete or six inches of dry concrete 6 monuments exceeding 3500 pounds shall be installed by the manufacturers recommendation prior to installation the installer shall submit an installation proposal for approval 7 for a period of two years from the date of installation it shall be the responsibility of the installer to correct any settlement leaning or other problems resulting from installation of monuments  bronze marker specifications bronze markers intended for placement in the cemetery shall comply with the following specifications 1 sizes and dimensions  sizes and dimensions shall be as follows a outside dimensions including flange 1 family memorials i width not less than 13 inches nor more than 24 inches ii length not less than 42 inches nor more than 60 inches 2 individual markers i width not less than 12 inches nor more than 18 inches ii length 24 inches 3 baby memorials i width not less than six inches nor more than ten inches ii length not less than 12 inches nor more than 20 inches b sloping flange 1 width two inches for both large and small markers 2 height of flange edges not less than threeeighths inch 3 thickness of metal not less than threesixteenths inch 2 attachment bolts attachment bolt requirements shall be as follows a six bronze attachment bolts shall be provided on the back face of each marker b a diameter of not less than fivesixteenths inch c exposed length of not less than three inches d deformation for concrete setting shall be required e bolts may be cast integrally or attached by a screw with threading of not less than threeeighths inch in case lugs are on the back face of the casting 3 materials material requirements shall be as follows a the standard of quality shall be in accordance with bulletin no 172a of the us bureau of standards for statuary bronze b the proportion of materials shall be 88 percent copper ten percent tin and two percent zinc a variation not exceeding three percent is permissible on each of such materials provided a minimum of two percent zinc must be used c all virgin metals must be used and mixed to a uniform alloy at proper temperature d no other alloys of metals or combinations of materials shall be acceptable 4 craftsmanship craftsmanship requirements shall be as follows a markers shall be free from sand holes pits or other imperfections which mar the appearance or impair the usefulness and stability of the finished markers b all ornaments shall be clean and sharp and all edges true and accurate to the standard dimensions set out in this section 5 lettering lettering requirements shall be as follows a careful spacing and accurate setting in line both vertically and horizontally shall be required b names dates inscriptions and emblems shall be arranged so as to result in an artistic and neat appearing plate c style of lettering shall be preferably roundfaced classic vshaped classic or flatfaced classic but other styles of lettering may be used subject to approval by the cemetery supervisor 6 finish finish requirements shall be as follows a castings shall be free from scale sand pinholes and pits b all ornamentation face of letters and background shall be handchased handtooled and burnished appropriately for a memorial tablet c matching of the approved color and texture as per the sample marker shall be done by an approved oxidizing process d no colored lacquer or lacquercarrying pigment shall be used  removal of noncompliant markers and monuments any marker or monument not complying with the provisions of this division shall be removed  bronze memorial vases approved bronze memorial vases may be substituted for any individual or baby bronze marker  use of metal other than standard bronze no metal other than standard bronze as prescribed by this division will be permitted in any lot in the cemetery  granite and marble marker specifications granite and marble markers intended for placement in the cemetery shall comply with the following specifications sizes and dimensions sizes and dimensions shall be as follows 1 family memorials a width not less than 16 inches nor more than 18 inches b length not less than 48 inches nor more than 60 inches c thickness four inches or greater 2 individual markers a width not less than 16 inches nor more than 18 inches b length not less than 24 inches nor more than 26 inches c thickness four inches or greater this does not apply to military markers 3 baby memorials a width not less than 12 inches nor more than 18 inches b length not less than 20 inches nor more than 26 inches c thickness four inches or greater  412008 civil emergencies footnotes  1  cross reference cross reference definitions generally  12 authority of mayor to declare a state of emergency a in the event of an emergency the mayor is hereby authorized and empowered to issue a public proclamation declaring to all persons the existence of a state of emergency b in the event the mayor is absent or for any reason unable to perform his duties then the mayor pro tem may declare a state of emergency and exercise all powers given to the mayor by this article  2192019 restrictions authorized during a state of emergency the mayor may impose any or all of the following restrictions 1 a curfew in order to more effective protect the lives safety and property of the people within the jurisdiction of the city the mayor can limit the curfew to areas specifically designated and described within the corporate limits of the city and to specific hours of the day or night and to exempt from the curfew police officers firefighters doctors nurses and such other classes of persons as may be essential to the preservation of public order and immediately necessary to the safety health and welfare needs of the people within the city 2 prohibit or regulate the possession transportation sale purchase storage and use of gasoline and dangerous weapons and substances except that this subsection does not authorize prohibitions or restrictions on lawfully possessed firearms or ammunition as used in street or roadway or upon any other public property except by persons in search of medical assistance food or other commodity or service necessary to sustain the wellbeing of themselves or their families or some member thereof 5 prohibit or restrict movements of people in public places 6 prohibit or regulate the participation in or carrying on of any business activity and prohibit or regulate the keeping open of places of business entertainment and public assembly 7 prohibit or restrict the operation of offices business establishments and other places to or from which people may travel or at which they may congregate 8 prohibit or restrict other activities or conditions specifically mentioned in the state of emergency declaration the control of which may be reasonably necessary to maintain order and protect the lives or property during the state of emergency  2192019 authority of mayor to request state policy and military forces and proclamation of martial law if in the sound discretion of the mayor it shall appear that the emergency is or that the threatened emergency is likely to be of such proportions that the means available to the city to maintain law and order are insufficient for such purpose then the mayor shall promptly and by the most expeditious means of communication inform the governor of the situation and request that such necessary police or military forces of the state be provided promptly if during an actual state of emergency the mayor shall find that the civil courts having jurisdiction within the city are unable to perform their lawful duties and that by reason of widespread lawlessness writs and other processes cannot be served or executed in the city then the mayor shall inform the governor of his findings and may recommend to the governor that a state of martial law be proclaimed to exist within the city  2192019 termination a state of emergency declared pursuant to this article shall remain in effect until terminated by the mayor or other authorized official restrictions or prohibitions imposed under a state of emergency declaration may be modified or rescinded by amendment to the state of emergency declaration  2192019 nuisances  46 state law reference authority to abate public health nuisances within city limits and one mile beyond gs 160a193 enumerated the existence of any of the following conditions on any lot or parcel of land whether improved or unimproved occupied or unoccupied within the city limits or within a distance of one mile beyond the city limits is hereby declared to be dangerous and prejudicial to the public health or safety and to constitute a public nuisance 1 the uncontrolled growth of noxious weeds or grass not grown for agricultural purposes to a height in excess of 12 inches on the average causing or threatening to cause a hazard detrimental to the public health or safety it shall also be the duty of the owner to cut and remove all weeds and other rank vegetation as often as necessary so as to comply with this subsection this subsection does not apply to lots exceeding one acre in size or to lots which are covered with trees however lots exceeding one acre or lots covered with trees shall be maintained in accordance with this subsection to a depth of ten feet from the property lines if and only if the adjacent property is occupied by a dwelling or other structure located within 50 feet of the property  2 any accumulation including burial of animal or vegetable matter that is offensive by virtue of odors or vapors or by the inhabitance therein of rats mice with authority to give written notice which may be served personally by registered mail or in any other manner authorized by law to the owner occupant or person in charge of such premises or to any two or all of such persons believed to be responsible for such violation the notice shall specify the condition which constitutes the violation and shall direct the addressee to abate such violation in a lawful manner within ten days from the date of the notice the notice shall also warn the addressee that failure to comply with such notice shall subject him to prosecution for his violation and in addition shall render him liable to the city for any costs and expenses which may be incurred by the city in the abatement of such violation under the provisions of subsection b of this section and that such costs and expenses shall constitute a lien upon the property involved b if upon the expiration of the time specified in any such notice the condition which constitutes the violation has not been abated in a lawful manner the city manager shall provide for the abatement of such condition by the most expedient means and the costs and expenses thereby incurred including any cost incurred in service of the notice shall be collected by the city tax collector from any one or more of the addressees served with notice and if such costs and expenses are not paid within 30 days the city tax collector shall make collection thereof in the manner provided by law for delinquent taxes or in any other manner authorized by law and the amount of such costs and expense shall constitute a lien in favor of the city upon the property upon which the violation occurred c in addition to the sanctions imposed in subsection b of this section a violation of this article or any order issued under this article shall also be a civil offense and shall subject the offender to a civil penalty as follows 1 if the offender shall abate the nuisance within ten days from the date of the notice and shall not within the preceding three years have been notified of any prior violation of this article no civil penalty shall be assessed 2 if the offender shall abate the nuisance within ten days from the date of the notice but shall within the preceding three years have been notified of any prior violation of this article a civil penalty in the amount of $20000 shall be assessed 3 if the offender shall not abate the nuisance within ten days from the date of the notice a civil penalty in the amount of $20000 shall be assessed for each day upon which inspection of the premises is made and the nuisance is found to either first exist or to be unabated for the purposes of this section only notices given on or after the effective date of  shall be considered as notice of any prior violation of this as affirmed or modified by the city council or by a court of competent jurisdiction within the time fixed in the fire prevention code shall severally for each and every such violation and noncompliance respectively be guilty of a misdemeanor and punished as provided by law b the imposition of one penalty for any violation shall not excuse the violation or permit it to continue all such persons shall be required to correct or remedy such violations or defects within a reasonable time when not otherwise specified each ten days that prohibited conditions are maintained shall constitute a separate offense c the application of the penalty set forth in subsection b of this section shall not be held to prevent the enforced removal of prohibited conditions  conflicts of law whenever any chief of the fire department shall be appointed by the city manager the chief shall be the commanding officer of the department and shall have control of all personnel and apparatus thereof the chief shall appoint an assistant chief and whatever other officers he deems are appropriate to carry out the activities of the fire department b the chief of the fire department shall take charge of and supervise the firefighting and extinguishing of all fires in the absence of the chief of the fire department from the scene of a fire the senior officer of the fire department present shall exercise the duties of the chief of the fire department c the chief of the fire department or in his absence the senior officer of the fire department present shall be in command of all police officers at the scene of a fire and such police officers shall obey all lawful commands given them by the chief or senior officer of the fire department present pursuant to this subsection  cross reference officers control over streets sidewalks etc gs 160a296 article i  in general paving it shall be unlawful for any person to do any paving on any sidewalk or street without first securing permission from the city as a prerequisite to such paving the street or sidewalk to be paved shall be surveyed by a competent surveyor to ascertain the proper grade and a report of such survey shall be filed with the city  excavation permit required  bond a it shall be unlawful for any person to make any excavation or cut paved portion of any street or sidewalk without first obtaining a permit from the city b before the issuance of any permit required by subsection a of this section there shall be executed by the applicant to the city on a form approved by the city a bond in a sum determined by the city to be sufficient to ensure that the streets and sidewalks will be replaced in a good and workmanlike manner such bond shall run for a period of not less than 12 months so that if the place where the excavation or cut is made pursuant to the permit shall give trouble within such 12month period the city will be protected against loss or damage by reason of repair to such cut or excavation  excavation safety measures it shall be unlawful for any person to fail neglect or refuse to 1 securely cover with planks any excavation in a street or sidewalk  2 place ropes around such excavation three feet from the ground  3 place a sufficient number of lights around such excavation before dark and exercise reasonable diligence to keep such lights burning  removal of dirt it shall be unlawful for any person to remove any dirt from any street or sidewalk without first securing a permit to do so from the city manager  ditches or gutters crossing sidewalks it shall be unlawful for any person to allow any open ditch or gutter to run across any sidewalk all ditches or drains crossing a sidewalk shall be run underground it shall be unlawful for any person after having been duly notified to remove or place underground any and all drains or ditches leading from his property and across the sidewalk to fail neglect or refuse to comply with such notice  railroad crossings at any point where a railroad crosses a street such crossing shall be constructed so as to maintain a uniform grade the entire width of the street intersection such crossing shall be constructed of clay wood or other material in such a way as to prevent a sudden rise or bump in the roadway or sidewalk when the roadbed of the railroad is lower than the street the incline shall be uniform and gradual where such crossings cannot be constructed so as to meet such requirements an elevated crossing shall be constructed according to such plans as shall be submitted to and approved by the city council  telephone wires and other wires transmitting electricity before any person shall place or locate in or over the streets or buildings in the city any fiber optic cable telephone or other wires transmitting electricity or light a plan in writing of the proposed location thereof shall be submitted to the electric superintendent for his approval  awnings shelters and sunshades it shall be unlawful for any person to erect or maintain any awning shelter or sunshade in front of any building if the awning shelter or sunshade is less than seven feet above the level of the sidewalk stationary awning arms shall not be less than eight feet above the level of the sidewalk the provisions of this section shall apply outside of the fire limits described in section 671  harrows and other machinery it shall be unlawful for any person to drag or run or cause to be drug or ran any harrow or other implement engine machine or tool upon any asphalt batholithic warrenite or other permanently paved street of the city which may in any way injure or cut the surface thereof it shall also be unlawful to injure any unpaved street and sidewalk in a like manner  skating skateboarding and inline skating it shall be unlawful for any person to skate skateboard or use inline skates upon any sidewalk or street except the streets which are designated as play streets by resolution or ordinance of the city council and are blocked or closed to traffic during certain hours  sidewalks in central business district a definitions the following words terms and phrases when used in this section shall have the meanings project the length of which shall be at least one block b be signed by the owners of more than 50 percent of the lots abutting the street for which the sidewalk is requested and such lots shall comprise more than 50 percent of the linear footage along such street c specify that the cost of materials used for the project be assessed to the owners of property abutting the project at an equal substances it shall be unlawful for any person owning or occupying any property within the city to fail refuse or neglect to remove from all sidewalks fronting such property any snow ice clay or other upon the occupants of buildings adjacent to such sidewalks and if such property is vacant the duty shall be upon the owner of such property  secs 32543280  reserved article iii  construction of undertaken in conjunction with or as a part of any parade picket line or group demonstration are hereby prohibited and declared unlawful 1 carrying on or about the person any firearm or any weapon or article including but not limited to blackjacks which constitutes a deadly weapon  2 taking or keeping of any dog or vicious animal whether leashed or unleashed except seeing eye or service dogs properly trained to assist blind and other disabled persons or law enforcement animals  picket and picket line regulations picket lines and picketing shall be subject to the following regulations 1 picketing may be conducted only on the sidewalks reserved for pedestrian movement and may not be conducted on the portion of a street used primarily for vehicular traffic 2 not more than ten picketers promoting the same objective shall be permitted to use either of the two sidewalks within a single block at any one time 3 picketers may carry written or printed placards or signs not exceeding two feet in width and two feet in length promoting the objective for which the picketing is done provided that the words used are not derogatory or defamatory in nature 4 picketers must march in single file and not abreast and not march closer together than 15 feet except in passing one another picketers shall not be allowed to walk more than five feet from the curbline and shall be in continuous motion 5 if picketers promoting different objectives desire to use the same sidewalk for picketing and such use would result in the presence of more than ten picketers on such sidewalk the chief of police shall allot time to each group of picketers for the use of such sidewalk on an equitable basis  secs 3219632220  reserved division 2  permits required it shall be unlawful for any person to organize conduct or participate in any parade picket line or group demonstration in or upon any street sidewalk or other public place within the city unless a permit has been issued by the city in accordance with the provisions of this division  applications the chief of police requires a written application for the permit required in section 32221 to be filed not less than 72 hours in advance of such parade picket line or group demonstration such application shall be on a form prescribed by the chief of police the chief of police shall require the application to be signed by the applicant and shall require that the applicant show the proposed time place purpose and size of such parade picket line or group demonstration and whether or not any minors below the age of 18 years shall participate  conditions a the chief of police shall refuse to issue the permit required in section 32221 when the activity or purpose stated in the application would violate any ordinance of the city or statute of the state or when the activity or purpose would constitute a clear and present danger to the public health or safety or would hinder or prevent the orderly movement of pedestrian or vehicular traffic on streets alleys or sidewalks b the chief of police shall specify in the permit whether or not minors below the age of 18 years will be permitted to participate the chief of police shall pass upon whether or not such minors may participate and shall base his determination upon whether or not the purpose time or place of the particular activity would be detrimental to or endanger the health safety or welfare of such minors or would interfere with their education c the chief of police shall require that the application for a permit shall specify and the permit shall designate the person in charge of the activity such person shall be required to accompany the parade picket line or group demonstration and shall carry such permit with him at that time such permit shall not be valid in the possession of any other person d the permit may set the starting time duration speed of travel and space between persons or vehicles in the parade picket line or group demonstration the permit may prescribe the portions or areas of streets sidewalks or other public places to be used and may impose such other reasonable requirements as the chief of police may prescribe for the control and free movement of pedestrian or vehicular traffic or for the health safety and property rights of the participants and the general public e among other considerations the chief of police shall consider and find as a requisite to issuance of the permit the following 1 the activity will not require excessive diversion of police from other necessary duties  2 the activity will not interfere with the rights of property owners in the area to enjoy peaceful and lawful occupancy and use of their property  3 the activity can be conducted without unreasonable interference with normal pedestrian or vehicular traffic in the area and will not prevent normal police and fire protection to the public and will not be likely to cause injury to persons or property or to provoke disorderly conduct or to create a public disturbance  authority to issue the chief of police is authorized to issue permits as required in section 32221  revocation the chief of police shall revoke any permit granted for a parade picket line or group demonstration for any of the following causes 1 the violation by any participant of section 32194  2 the failure to comply with the terms and conditions of
